revised_title: The Formation of Fat in the Intestines of Living Animals
tldr: The author investigates the formation of fat in the intestines of living animals, specifically focusing on the role of the colon and lower intestines. He suggests that fat is formed in these areas and provides examples of fatty concretions found in the large intestines. The author also explores the role of bile in converting animal substances into fat and its potential implications for understanding various disorders of the lower bowels.
